title: Canada's top 10 amusement parks [Photos]
text:
By Nicole Feenstra , Postmedia Network First posted: Wednesday, August 19, 2015 06:00 AM MDT Canada's top 10 amusement parks Previous Next 
Calaway Park, Calgary: The largest amusement park in western Canada, Calaway Park provides plenty of summer fun for the entire family. Attractions include a log flume, a corkscrew rollercoaster, gigantic swing ride and plenty of food booths, games and other daredevil rides to keep everyone entertained. There are also attractions like a ballpit and Theodore Tugboat playground for young children. (LYLE ASPINALL/Postmedia Network) 
Canada's Wonderland, Vaughan, Ont.: Located just north of Toronto, Canada's Wonderland is the largest amusement park in Canada and one of the best known. Featuring more than 200 attractions - including the frightening new Leviathan coaster, the tallest and fastest roller coaster in Canada - Canada's Wonderland offers rides, games and fun activities the whole family will enjoy. Don't forget to try a famous funnel cake when visiting! (Courtesy Canada's Wonderland) 
Centreville Amusement Park, Toronto Islands: A short ferry ride from Toronto's downtown core to the Toronto Islands reveals Centreville, an iconic amusement park loved by Ontario families for generations. The park includes a mini railway, a rare vintage carousal, swan boats and other children's rides. (Debbie Holloway/Postmedia Network) 
Playland, Vancouver: As the oldest amusement park in Canada, Playland at Vancouver's Pacific National Exhibition is one of summer's highlights for British Columbians. An annual fair to celebrate the end of summer each August is an especially big draw for visitors, with food booths, monster truck shows and all the iconic rides loved by guests to Playland. The park re-opens in the fall for the haunted attractions of Halloween Fright Nights. (ROB KRUYT/Postmedia Network) 
La Ronde, Montreal: Canada's second largest amusement park, beat only by Toronto's Canada's Wonderland, is one of the top summer spots for families in Quebec. Opened in 1967 as the midway for Expo 67, there are a total of 40 rides at the park. The world's highest double track coaster, Le Monstre, and a Nintendo video game zone are popular draws. (JOEL LEMAY/Postmedia Network) 
Calypso Theme Waterpark, Limoges, Ont.: Located near the nation's capital, this theme water park is Canada's largest water park. Beat the heat at the gigantic wave pool (it's the size of three NHL rinks), on the jungle river ride or by speeding down a water slide. (Courtesy Calypso Theme Waterpark) 
Galaxyland, West Edmonton Mall, Alta: Only the iconic West Edmonton Mall could deliver the world's second largest indoor amusement park in such fun style. Formerly known as Fantasyland, this indoor park houses the world's longest and tallest indoor roller coaster and the world's tallest indoor tower ride. Open year round, Galaxyland is the perfect spot for kids to pass the time while the parents shop the mall's numerous specialty stores. (DAVID FULLER/Postmedia Network) 
Upper Clements Park, Annapolis Valley, N.S.: This lively theme park offers more than 30 attractions to families on Canada's east coast. Take a spin on the only wooden roller coaster in Atlantic Canada -- the Tree Topper roller coaster, -- take on friends on the bumper boats, or stay until late for concerts and fireworks. (Courtesy Upper Clements Park/Facebook) 
Fallsview Indoor Waterpark, Niagara Falls, Ont.: The Fallsview Indoor Waterpark is the largest indoor water park in North America, great for a family trip in the summer or winter months. Located just minutes from the edge of the famous Niagara Falls, this water park has 16 slides, an indoor wave pool and hot springs in its three acre indoor space. (Courtesy Fallsview Indoor Waterpark) 
Tinkertown Family Fun Park, Winnipeg: This outdoor amusement park features more than 20 rides, sure to keep families entertained this summer. Ride the spinning apples, the Tilt-a-Whirl or Merry-Go-Round before taking a break at Water Wars or the mini-golf course. (Courtesy Tinkertown Family Fun Park/Facebook) Article
